Using a spine of rock to climb up
Unintentionally coming away from the rock in an uncontrolled manor
Advice on how to complete a climb
A type of hold utilising only the tips of the fingers.
The hardest part of a route.
Jamming your hand into a crack, and pulling a fist to lock in place. Very painful, and usually a tape glove is used to protection the hands.
Waving leg away from the rock, for balance.
Using the heel to hook over the edge of a hold.
Placing a foot on a high hold and moving your weight onto it by pushing with the legs, and pulling with the arms.
Placing the foot against the surface of the wall and using friction to hold it in place
Similar to a heel hook, but with toes.
